author: COMSOL
description:
This model use a mode analysis study to find the complex effective indices of a microstructured optical fiber (MOF), consisting of air holes in a silica host. As the effective index is smaller than the refractive index of the silica background material, the modes are leaky.

The model demonstrates both the use of a perfectly matched layer (PML) and the use of the Scattering boundary condition to truncate the simulation domain.

The real and imaginary parts of the effective index compare well to values from a published paper.
label: microstructured_optical_fiber.mph
name: root

title: Leaky Modes in a Microstructured Optical Fiber
